intro: Borreria stolzii, commonly known as the Mexican fireweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Borreria stolzii is often found in dry, rocky soils and can thrive in full sun. It is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
